snippet: At the Zeinhom morgue in Cairo, men who said they were neighborhood watchmen tried to keep bereaved families from telling their stories.
abstract: Families attempting to collect bodies of loved ones from Zeinhom morgue in Cairo are confronted by hired government thugs; men have been put in place to stop bereaved from talking to journalists, keeping government control over narrative surrounding violence in Egypt.

byline.contributor: Moustafa Kashef and Bryan Denton contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: At the Zeinhom morgue in Cairo, men who said they were neighborhood watchmen tried to keep bereaved families from telling their stories.

headline.main: At Cairo Morgue, Families Face Menace From Nameless Men
headline.print_headline: At Cairo Morgue, Families Face Menace From Nameless Men

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
